snippet: The three men were sentenced under the strict provisions of a new law in India that has caused unease even among some women’s advocates.
abstract: Mohammed Kasim Sheikh, Salim Ansari and Vijay Jadhav, men convicted of participating in a gang rape in 2013 of a photojournalist in Mumbai, India, are sentenced to death under strict provisions of a new rape law; death penalty is rarely imposed and more rarely carried out in India; some women's rights advocates say they are uneasy that the men had been sentenced to die.

byline.original: By MANSI CHOKSI and GARDINER HARRIS
byline.contributor: Mansi Choksi reported from Mumbai, and Gardiner Harris from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: The three men were sentenced under the strict provisions of a new law in India that has caused unease even among some women’s advocates.

headline.main: 3 in India Sentenced to Death for 2 Rapes
headline.print_headline: 3 in India Sentenced to Death for 2 Rapes
